channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Discovering the Music of Antiquity
channel.desc: The discovery of an ancient music score in the Louvre sets researchers on a mission to recreate the music as it was originally heard by the Greeks 2,400 years ago.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: John Williams Film Prom
channel.desc: Movie magic from John Williams's back catalogue, including Star Wars, Harry Potter and ET, as the Proms celebrates the 85th birthday of the world's favourite film composer.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Battlefield Britain
channel.desc: Peter and Dan Snow on the battles that shaped our nation, using state-of-the-art graphics. The story of the turbulent events culminating in the Battle of Hastings in 1066.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mysteries of the Bayeux Tapestry
channel.desc: Experts from archaeologists to astrophysicists offer new insights on the Bayeux Tapestry, an artefact which, despite its fame, has remained shrouded in mystery.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Mystery of the Desert Kites
channel.desc: Documentary following an international team of archaeologists and researchers as they explore the extraordinary groups of megastructures that stretch across the Arabian desert.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The One Jasper Carrott
channel.desc: Jasper Carrott hosts a comedy special, featuring stand-up, sketches, a reprise of The Detectives with Robert Powell and a song with his house band, with Rick Wakeman and Bev Bevan.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Discovering the Music of Antiquity
channel.desc: The discovery of an ancient music score in the Louvre sets researchers on a mission to recreate the music as it was originally heard by the Greeks 2,400 years ago.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Battlefield Britain
channel.desc: Peter and Dan Snow on the battles that shaped our nation, using state-of-the-art graphics. The story of the turbulent events culminating in the Battle of Hastings in 1066.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Patrick Marber Remembers... After Miss Julie
channel.desc: Patrick Marber looks back on his 1995 adaptation of August Strindberg's classic play Miss Julie.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Planet Earth

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Vienna
channel.desc: A look at the demise of the Habsburgs and at how Vienna ushered in the modern age.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Rise of the Nazis
channel.desc: In the 1960s and 70s, a few diehards continue hunting the last of the Nazis. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Girl Who Talked to Dolphins
channel.desc: The story of a 1960s experiment that tried to teach a dolphin to speak English. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Anselm Kiefer
channel.desc: Alan Yentob joins Anselm Kiefer at his studios in France and Germany as he prepares for a retrospective at the Royal Academy.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Planet Earth
channel.desc: Documentary series which celebrates earth in all its glory. This edition looks at mountains, beginning with the birth of a mountain and ending at the summit of Everest.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: It's embarrassing enough when Tom and Barbara find themselves with fleas. But how can they stop these unwanted guests from catching on with Jerry and Margo.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes, Minister
channel.desc: A normally efficient local council is late with some paperwork, and Sir Humphrey wants to make an example of them.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Billy Connolly
channel.desc: Featuring the long-lost film of Billy Connolly's 1975 Ireland tour.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Face to Face with Billy Connolly
channel.desc: Jeremy Isaacs talks to Scottish comedian Billy Connolly about stand-up comedy, bodily functions and the night someone set fire to his hair.

channel.title: Billy Connolly
channel.desc: Billy Connolly's life is revealed in all its glory. Contains strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Billy Connolly
channel.desc: Billy is in the Scotland of his childhood, discussing knitted woolly swimming trunks. Contains strong language.

channel.title: The Trials of Oscar Pistorius
channel.desc: When a judge is assigned to the Oscar Pistorius trial, the world watches closely. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Planet Earth
channel.desc: Documentary series which celebrates earth in all its glory. This edition follows the descent of the planet's mightiest rivers from their mountain sources to the sea.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: What Are UFOs?
channel.desc: After years in the shadows, UFOs are being studied seriously. Follow scientists as they try to unravel the mystery of the strangest objects in our skies.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Gangland Lemurs - Wildlife on One
channel.desc: A look at the life of ring-tailed lemurs on the African island of Madagascar, who live in female-dominated gangs and continually fight for territory with their neighbours.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Tribe
channel.desc: Explorer Bruce Parry takes part in the initiation rite of the Babongo tribe of Gabon. Contains graphic scenes of drug use.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Eileen Atkins Remembers... Mrs Dalloway
channel.desc: Dame Eileen Atkins tells the story of her lifelong fascination with Virginia Woolf and recalls how she took on the challenge of adapting Woolf's Mrs Dalloway for the big screen.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mrs Dalloway
channel.desc: An adaptation of the classic Virginia Woolf novel. A woman struggles to come to terms with the amorous feelings that a close platonic friend clearly holds for her.
